Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior: reserved with possible trace of band at junction of rim and body; exterior: short diagonal strokes around rim; narrow band at junction with bowl; black-figure decoration consisting of lion (part of neck, back and tail; with added red on mane), to left; pendant and complete rosettes with red centres as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Stage 1 of Group D of the Sphinx and Lion Style. Although the imagery is lively, the execution of the figures is loose and careless. The rosette on vases of Stage 1 appears infantile. Contrary to the norm, whereby lions are depicted facing right, the lion on this sherd is facing left.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 148, p. 310, no. 1288, pl. 167)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. XII, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2078) (phase 2)
